required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ULTRASOUND GUIDED PERIPHERAL VENOUS CANNULATION IN PATIENT UNDERGOING ELECTIVE SURGERY UNDER GENERAL ANESTHESIA
clinical_study.official_title: ULTRASOUND GUIDED PERIPHERAL VENOUS CANNULATION IN PATIENT UNDERGOING ELECTIVE SURGERY UNDER GENERAL ANESTHESIA

lead_sponsor.agency: Masarykova Nemocnice v Usti nad Labem, Krajska Zdravotni a.s.

clinical_study.source: Masarykova Nemocnice v Usti nad Labem, Krajska Zdravotni a.s.

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates two different techniques for peripheral venous cannulation in operating theatre. Ultrasound guided insertion of peripheral cannula in comparison with conventional approach without any ultrasound guidance.

detailed_description.textblock: Peripheral venous catheter placement is one of the key tasks of an anesthesiologist, which needs to be completed before surgery in general anesthesia. The reported success rate of peripheral venous cannulation, when performed in a conventional manner, without any special technical tools which facilitate finding the peripheral vein, is only 51% during the first trial. However, up to 7% of patients require more than three cannulation trials. Ultrasound guidance of peripheral venous catheter insertion may increase success rate and shorten time to securing peripheral cannula. However, this approach has not been verified in the setting of operating theatre so far. This project aims to set the role of ultrasound guided venous cannulation in operating theatre.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are divided by block randomization into two arms. Arm A peripheral vein cannulation with ultrasound guidance and Arm B conventional cannulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate of seccuring peripheral vein for first atempt.
primary_outcome.description: Comparing success rate of securing peripheral vein for first atempt in both methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall succes rate in securing peripheral vein.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare number of atempts that was neccessery to secure peripheral vein.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complication rate after securing peripheral vein.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare complication rate after securing peripheral vein with both methods.
Compare time that was need to secure peripheral vein in both methods.

clinical_study.condition: Peripheral Vein Cannulation Guided by Ultrasound

arm_group.description: Ultrasound guided insertion of peripheral vein cannula.
Catheter insertion by conventional approach, without ultrasound guidance

intervention.description: The target vein is directly identified by ultrasound, the procedure of peripheral venous cathether insertion is performed conventionally, without ultrasound guidance
Cannulation is done the conventional way without any ultrasound use.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
Age <18 years Patient disagreement with the insertion of peripheral venous catheter Disagreement of the patient with inclusion in a clinical trial Contraindication of ultrasound examination of the venous system Contraindication of the introduction of peripheral venous cannula on both upper limbs Necessity of securing other vein acces than peripheral Contraindications of cannulation of peripheral vein

facility.name: Masarykova Nemocnice v Ústí nad Labem, Krajská Zdravotní a.s.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Masarykova Nemocnice v Usti nad Labem, Krajska Zdravotni a.s.
